channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Resident dumping homewares, 12th September
item.description:
A resident has emptied their home and left loads of items including wardrobes etc
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Burnett Close, Hackney, London

item.title: Bollard knocked over, outside no 30 Glimpsing green, 12th September
item.description:
Bollard knocked completely over yesterday by a vehicle, causing a hole where it was, a trip hazard.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glimpsing Green, Upper Belvedere, London

item.title: 20 inch pothole in front of council office building!, 12th September
item.description:
The hole is around the street drain, too wide and too deep all cars hit their bumpers and makes unnecessary noise to residents.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-12, Opal Street, Kennington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Metal frame on piramid park, 12th September
item.description:
It’s been more than 6 months since this problem appeared, the metal frame is still on the playground, and as you can see is half of it destroyed. My daughter was running around and because of the wind this frame almost felt on her !!!!! Is more danger than anything else , I bought gir so scared , thanks god it stopped on the dragon and didn’t felt on my daughter!!! Please do something as it’s extremely dangerous on this playground for kids who play here .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Main Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Always throwing rubbish in our bin, 12th September
item.description:
This has been going on for months and months. Several people are using our bins for their rubbish when they have free bins for themselves if so unfair and nothing’s been done about it we can’t use our bins because there’s never any room which means we now have rubbish that constantly piling up because there just no room. We live here we should have to worry about people putting their rubbish in our bins. This is happening on block 119 ampleforth road SE2 9BG

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sewell Road, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hackney Council look more rats what are you doing about this. People pay their rents and service charges come on get your act together people don't deserve to live with rat vermin around them. I have to walk this way to take my child to school., 12th September
item.description:
Rat pest control required.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Daintry Way, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lorry totally obstructing footpath, 12th September
item.description:
The engine was off, and the footpath was completely impassable. When challenged, the staff said it was inconvenient to park further away.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ebenezer Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vehicle Dumped In Car Park, 12th September
item.description:
2 x VWs dumped in car park of Pickering Close. The vehicles are blocking other vehicles parked in their spaces.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pickering Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: I so scared there was a big monster rat outside my house there is an infestation of rats around the neighborhood. Could Hackney Council please address this issue vermin everywhere. Making nest in bushes/trees on public land. Resident is storing a waste blue barrel bin. Environment health. Could not even walk past the rat I felt so intimidated. The rat was not scared of me. Please I have children., 12th September
item.description:
Pest control required neighborhood infestation monster rats. Oh God I pray. Please Hackney Council deal with this issue.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Daintry Way, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter and debris on pavement and gutters that need sweeping, 12th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66, Lennard Road, Penge, London

item.title: Parking, 12th September
item.description:
Herne mews Under flats parking being used for storage of cabs that are for lease this is now causing a problem for the residents of this turning as we have no where to park as this company is parking there cabs under the flats we can’t have any visitors as they have taken up all spaces the residents have had enough and we need action taken asap as this has bean going on for some time

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Herne Mews, Edmonton, London
Report on FixMyStreet
